$Joe Ferguson walked on 3-2 pitch that catcher Manny Sanguillen thought was strike three; he rolled the ball to the mound; Lee Lacy, the runner on 3B, thought it was strike 3 and started for the dugout; Jimmy Wynn, the runner on 2B, saw it was ball 4 and tried to score; pitcher Jerry Reuss retrieved the ball and threw it to Sanguillen who ran back to HP to apply the tag; HP umpire Satch Davidson made no call as Sanguillen threw to 3B where Richie Hebner stepped on 3B appealing that Lacy was out; Lacy, standing in front of the dugout, ran to HP, Hebner threw to Sanguillen, who applied the tag; Davidson ruled Lacy out and both benches argued; after an 11 minute delay, the umpires ruled that Lacy scored without touching HP since it was 'automatic' on a bases-loaded walk and that Wynn was out trying to advance1974PIT.EVN.regular.comment.csv"

ej,leppd101,C,pullf901,Disputed HR call $the Pirates claimed that Johnny Bench's home run hit top of the wall and bounced back while 1B umpire Frank Pulli said it hit top of the wall, caromed off the back wall before bouncing back onto the field; Pirates Coach Don Leppert ejected by Pulli1974PIT.EVN.regular.comment.csv"

ej,andes101,M,sudoe901,Beanball war ej,kosca101,P,sudoe901,Beanball war ej,kirke102,P,sudoe901,Beanball war $both benches cleared after Jack Billingham hit Bruce Kison; a 20 minute brawl ensued when Reds manager Sparky Anderson stepped on Ed Kirkpatrick's foot and Kirkpatrick shoved Anderson; Andy Kosko punched Kirkpatrick in retaliation for the shove; Anderson, Kosco and Kirkpatrick ejected by HP umpire Ed Sudol; 1B umpire Lee Weyer's shirt was torn during the melee1974PIT.EVN.regular.comment.csv"
